pages.text: I've decided to settle and build a more permanent shelter near the village the wandering trader mentioned.$(br2)Without the saw and stonecutter, this construction work would be torment.
While the blast furnace and smoker are great for smelting ores and cooking food, I've found that the kiln saves me a lot of time smelting other materials, such as glass and other items.

pages.title: Repairs
pages.text: Iâ€™ve been using my anvil to repair my tools so much it has started to form cracks on the surface, lucky for me I can just repair it! Imagine having to craft a new one using THREE iron blocks when I can use only ONE of them to repair it.

pages.title: Chimneys
pages.text: I ended up getting into $(l:cooking/cooking)cooking$(/l) so much I needed a chimney to not smoke up the place.

pages.title: Random placement
pages.text: I wanted to add some noise to my block placement, so I made this handy tool that places a random block from my $(l)hotbar$(), making it easy to diversify my builds.

pages.title: Dyeing item frames
pages.text: After I finished building my home, I had so many items to store away I needed to sort them, luckily for me, I can make item frames and dye them to make chests easily recognizable!

pages.title: Fancier beds
pages.text: Finally I can sleep in my new home! What better way to sleep comfortably in a custom made bed? I designed a pattern intended for banners, and made a bedsheet after it! Although the bedsheet manufacturer doesn't seem to work with newer brands...
